channel.title: NPR Topics: Economy
channel.description: NPR news on the U.S. and world economy, the World Bank, and Federal Reserve. Commentary on economic trends. Subscribe to NPR Economy podcasts and RSS feeds.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Is a 50-year mortgage really that much crazier than a 30-year one?
item.description: Last week, the internet piled on President Trump's proposal for a 50-year mortgage. But maybe it's not as crazy as it sounds.
item.content:encoded: Last week, the internet piled on President Trump's proposal for a 50-year mortgage. But maybe it's not as crazy as it sounds.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: How women over 30 are rewriting the single mom narrative in America
item.description: Forty percent of babies in the U.S. are born to unmarried mothers. Increasingly, those moms are over 30, at a time when teen pregnancy has fallen off a cliff and births are declining for younger women.
item.content:encoded:
Forty percent of babies in the U.S. are born to unmarried mothers. Increasingly, those moms are over 30, at a time when teen pregnancy has fallen off a cliff and births are declining for younger women.

(Image credit: Maansi Srivastava)
item.dc:creator: Pallavi Gogoi

item.title: Americans could see a big sticker shock for Thanksgiving turkeys this year
item.description: Wholesale prices for a turkey have jumped 40% from a year ago.
item.content:encoded:
Wholesale prices for a turkey have jumped 40% from a year ago.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: A year from now, hemp shops could disappear under a new federal ban
item.description: WFAE's Steve Harrison reports on how the new spending bill imposes new restrictions on hemp and CBD producers nationwide now that the government has re-opened.
item.content:encoded: WFAE's Steve Harrison reports on how the new spending bill imposes new restrictions on hemp and CBD producers nationwide now that the government has re-opened.
item.dc:creator: STEVE HARRISON

item.title: Trump scraps tariffs on beef, coffee, tropical fruit in a push to lower prices
item.description: President Trump announced the removal of U.S. tariffs on beef, coffee, tropical fruits and other commodities amid pressure to address high consumer prices.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump announced the removal of U.S. tariffs on beef, coffee, tropical fruits and other commodities amid pressure to address high consumer prices.

(Image credit: Manuel Balce Ceneta)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Amid ICE crackdowns, migrants are sending more money to some Central American countries
item.description: Planet Money talks to immigrants in the U.S. and people in Honduras to try to figure out why remittances are surging to some countries right as it is harder for immigrants here to find work.
item.content:encoded: Planet Money talks to immigrants in the U.S. and people in Honduras to try to figure out why remittances are surging to some countries right as it is harder for immigrants here to find work.
item.dc:creator: Erika Beras

item.title: Better late than never: The delayed September jobs report will be out next week
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics says it will report on September's job gains and unemployment rate next week. That's the first of many overdue economic reports held up by the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
The Bureau of Labor Statistics says it will report on September's job gains and unemployment rate next week. That's the first of many overdue economic reports held up by the government shutdown.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Economic promises helped Trump get elected. Now he has an affordability problem
item.description: Americans are feeling the strain of high prices, even as President Trump tries to tout "record highs" in the stock market.
item.content:encoded:
Americans are feeling the strain of high prices, even as President Trump tries to tout "record highs" in the stock market.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Tallying up the cost of the longest government shutdown in U.S. history
item.description: Economists are starting to put a price tag on the six-week government shutdown. But some of their calculations will be difficult to make because the shutdown temporarily limited government data.
item.content:encoded: Economists are starting to put a price tag on the six-week government shutdown. But some of their calculations will be difficult to make because the shutdown temporarily limited government data.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: The government can now get back to measuring the economy with shutdown over
item.description: Now that the government shutdown is over, federal number crunchers are back at work. It could take time, though, to make up for the jobs reports and inflation scorecards we missed in the last 6 weeks.
item.content:encoded: Now that the government shutdown is over, federal number crunchers are back at work. It could take time, though, to make up for the jobs reports and inflation scorecards we missed in the last 6 weeks.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley
